349.article_body: Xiaomi has reportedly fired over 900 employees as its revenue dropped nearly 20% in the June quarter. A report said that the layoffs account for nearly 3% of Xiaomi’s workforce. Hit by COVID-19 restrictions, the company’s sales fell 20% year-on-year to 70.17 billion yuan, marking a decline from its previous quarter when it posted its first revenue drop since listing.

350.title: Mahindra shares viral post on Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's advice, calls it 'worth billions'
350.article_body: Anand Mahindra has shared a viral post on late billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's old interview, wherein he said his worst investment had been his health and urged others to "invest the most in that". "Rakesh gave the most valuable and profitable investment advice ever. It's advice that is worth billions...it requires investing your time, not your money," Mahindra said.

351.title: BJP will do better in 2024 if Kejriwal becomes Opposition's PM face: Assam CM
351.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that BJP would win by a better margin if AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal is projected as Opposition's PM candidate in the next general election. "People in many states do not know Kejriwal and his party. It would be very good for BJP...as most people haven't even heard his name," Sarma added.

352.title: Tsitsipas beats world no.1  Medvedev to enter final at Cincinnati Open
352.article_body: World number seven Stefanos Tsitsipas defeated world number one Daniil Medvedev to reach the final for the first time at the Cincinnati Open. Tsitsipas won with a scoreline of 7-6(8-6), 3-6, 6-3 in the semi-final. He will face Croatian Borna Coric in the summit clash. Notably, it was only the third time that Tsitsipas defeated Medvedev in their 10-match history.

353.title: Twitter employees may get only half of their annual bonus, warns company
353.article_body: Twitter has warned employees they may only receive half of their annual bonuses, the company confirmed to The New York Times. In an email to staff, CFO Ned Segal said Twitter's financial challenges will affect the annual bonuses they receive. Twitter's bonus pool is currently at 50% of what it could be if Twitter met its financial targets, he added.

354.title: People said 'You're such a b**ch': Barkha on reaction to her 'Masaba...' role
354.article_body: Actress Barkha Singh, speaking about people's reaction to her performance in 'Masaba Masaba 2', has said, "Almost everyone close to me had a similar reaction, 'Wow Barkha, you're such a b**ch'." Barkha revealed her introduction scene in the series was also her audition scene. "I'd give credit to Masaba Gupta, she made sure that I was feeling easy," she added.

355.title: Every morning Centre wakes up, starts CBI-ED game: Arvind Kejriwal
355.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal tweeted on Sunday that every morning the central government "wakes up and starts this CBI-ED game". This comes as CBI issued a Look Out Notice against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and others. The central government should work with state governments to fight unemployment and inflation, instead, "they are fighting with the whole country," he added.

356.title: Build democracy where differences in identities & opinions are respected: CJI
356.article_body: CJI NV Ramana urged the people to build a democracy filled with vibrancy and idealism, where differences in identities and opinions are respected. "Don’t allow corrupt thoughts. Don’t tolerate injustices. Be sensitive to the needs of the community and society," CJI Ramana said on Saturday. The CJI further said that the people should have faith in the judiciary.

357.title: Chemical tanker crashes into cargo ship off the coast of Japan
357.article_body: A chemical tanker crashed into a cargo ship off the coast of southwestern Japan on Saturday, the coast guard said. None of the 20 crew members on board the two vessels were injured in the incident. The cargo ship had initially begun to sink after some oil leaked from its engine but it was brought under control, an official said.

358.title: UP minister returns without attending event as college doesn't open gate
358.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Higher Education Minister Yogendra Upadhyaya returned from the entrance of a college in Agra without attending an exhibition as the college gate wasn’t opened for him. The minister reportedly waited for 15 minutes and returned "seemingly irritated". Meanwhile, the college administration has ordered a probe into the incident and sought an explanation from the organisers.

359.title: Alia Bhatt reveals she was paid ₹15 lakh for her debut film 'Student Of The Year'
359.article_body: In an interview, actress Alia Bhatt revealed she was paid ₹15 lakh for her debut film 'Student Of The Year'. "I...deposited the cheque to my mother and very nicely I said, 'Mumma you handle the money.' And till date, my mother handles my money," she said. Alia added she doesn't know how much money she has in her bank account.

360.title: WhatsApp may allow users to recover messages deleted by mistake: Report
360.article_body: WhatsApp is working on a feature to allow users to recover messages deleted by mistake when they tap 'delete for me' instead of 'delete for everyone', WABetaInfo reported. The feature will allow users to restore a deleted message by clicking undo on a bar that will be shown to them for a few seconds after they have deleted a message.

361.title: People are not accepting B'wood due to its hypocrisy, arrogance: Vivek
361.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri, in a statement, has said that the people have seen through the "hypocrisy" and "arrogance" of Bollywood and now people are unwilling to accept it. "Go to any middle-class, urban, semi-urban household and interview them and you will find how people hate the arrogance, glossy lifestyle and the disconnect of Bollywood with real-life audiences," he added.

362.title: BJP is saying it will bring Eknath Shinde in T'gana, topple our govt: KCR
362.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Saturday claimed that BJP is saying it would bring down his government in Telangana. "The BJP is saying that they will bring Eknath Shinde here and topple our government. Who will do this? You are saying this because of your arrogance," CM Rao added. "No section benefitted under PM Modi's rule," Rao stated.

363.title: Mumbai local train services to be hit as Railways to carry out mega block
363.article_body: Mumbai local train services will be hit on Sunday as Central Railway and Western Railway zone will carry out mega block on its suburban sections for maintenance works. Harbour line passengers have been permitted to travel via Main line and Western Railway from 10 am to 6 pm and special locals will run on Panvel-Kurla section during the block period.

364.title: Want permanent peace with India, war not an option: Pakistan PM
364.article_body: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has said that Pakistan wants to have "permanent peace" with India through dialogue as war is not an option for either of the countries to resolve the Kashmir issue. Sharif also said that sustainable peace in the region was linked to the resolution of the Kashmir issue as per UN resolutions.

365.title: Noida Police issues traffic advisory after Tyagi community calls 'mahapanchayat'
365.article_body: Noida Traffic Police issued a traffic diversion plan for commuters after Tyagi community called for 'mahapanchayat' today in support of Shrikant Tyagi, a self-proclaimed politician who was recently arrested. The 'mahapanchayat' will take place at Maharishi Ashram Ramlila Maidan. As per the organisers, lakhs of members of the Tyagi community from across western UP will attend the rally.

366.title: Tell me where to come: Sisodia after CBI issues Look Out Notice against him
366.article_body: After CBI issued Look Out Notice against Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia and others in Delhi Excise Policy Scam, Sisodia took to Twitter to say, "All your raids have failed...now you have issued a Look Out Notice...What is this gimmick, Modi ji?" "I'm roaming freely in Delhi, tell me where to come? You can't find me?" his tweet read.

367.title: By the time you get back from pee break, England are all out: Boycott
367.article_body: Ex-England batsman Geoffrey Boycott said it was "madness" for England batters to try and attack South Africa pacers when they were bowling with the new ball in the first Test. "When you watch England face pacers...you don't want to get up...go for a pee because if you do, by the time you get back, they'll be all out," added Boycott.

368.title: 23-year-old Haryana man dies by suicide over alleged delay in visa for Canada
368.article_body: A 23-year-old man in Haryana died by suicide over an alleged delay in his student visa for Canada. After being missing for two days, his body was recovered from a canal in Kurukshetra. While his visa arrived a day after he went missing, as per an acquaintance, he had been upset ever since his friend's visa to Canada came.

369.title: Delhi people to get missed call, WhatsApp options to register choice for power subsidy
369.article_body: The Delhi government will release a phone number with missed call and WhatsApp options for city residents to choose if they want to continue availing free electricity scheme from October 1. "Delhiites will also have...convenience of opting in through a QR (Quick Response) code on the bill or by visiting the discom centre," Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said.

370.title: Ford unveils concept car with digital floor, glass roof & chess piece controller
370.article_body: Ford Motor has unveiled a futuristic concept car modelled after its Lincoln brand's first luxury vehicle. The Lincoln Model L100 has a glass roof, reverse-hinged doors and a 'digital floor' featuring a large screen that can be personalised. The autonomous vehicle also replaces the traditional steering wheel with a jewel-inspired chess piece controller and allows changes in seating configurations.

371.title: Delhi Excise Policy best of its kind: Deputy CM Manish Sisodia
371.article_body: The Delhi Excise Policy 2021-22 was the "best" of its kind and would have earned ₹10,000 crore every year had the ex-LG not been "asked" to change his decision at the last minute, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said on Saturday. His statement comes after CBI conducted a raid at his residence in connection with the excise policy case.

372.title: Wish to work with Nawazuddin Siddiqui, he's wonderful: 'KGF' actor Yash
372.article_body: Actor Yash, who featured in the 'KGF' franchise, was asked which Bollywood actor would he work with. To this, he replied, "I wish to work with Nawazuddin Siddiqui. I feel he is a wonderful actor." Nawazuddin is known for movies like 'Gangs Of Wasseypur' franchise, 'Manto', 'Mom'. Nawazuddin will feature in 'Tiku Weds Sheru'.

373.title: SpaceX Dragon spacecraft returns from ISS with 4,000 pounds of cargo
373.article_body: An uncrewed SpaceX Dragon cargo spacecraft has returned from the International Space Station with over 4,000 pounds of valuable scientific experiments and other cargo. With this, SpaceX completed its 25th cargo resupply mission to the space station. SpaceX launched the mission in July and delivered 5,800 pounds of science experiments, crew supplies and other critical cargo.

374.title: UP lawyer booked for stalking woman judge, peeping into her office
374.article_body: A woman judge posted in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur lodged an FIR against a lawyer for allegedly harassing and stalking her, the police said. The lawyer allegedly followed the judge on walks wearing matching clothes and passed lewd remarks. The judge further told police that lawyer Mohammad Haroon peeped into her office through a hole in the wall and messaged her.

375.title: Look Out Circular issued against Sisodia, others in Delhi Excise Policy Scam: Report
375.article_body: Days after CBI conducted raids at several locations in connection with Delhi's Excise Policy scam, probe agency has now issued Look Out Circular (LOC) against all accused named in the scam, reports said. A Look Out Circular has also been issued against Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia. Those named in scam have been restricted from travelling abroad, officials said.

376.title: Daughter of Russian Prez's ally called 'Putin's brain' killed in car blast: Report
376.article_body: Daria Dugina, the 29-year-old daughter of Russian President Vladimir Putin's close aide and philosopher Alexander Dugin, has died in a car explosion in Moscow, according to state media. It is not clear if Alexander Dugin, who's known as 'Putin's brain', was the intended target. Unverified videos of the scene shows a car on fire with Alexander Dugin watching in shock.

377.title: Debina & I are in happy space: Gurmeet on being trolled over 2nd pregnancy
377.article_body: Actor Gurmeet Choudhary has reacted to him and his wife Debina Bonnerjee being trolled after announcing second pregnancy four months after having their first child. "I don't pay heed to trolls as they are everywhere...they criticise everyone...Debina and I are in a very happy space. Only we know our truths," he stated. Gurmeet added he never reads the comments.

378.title: It didn't work out: Rahul on his 1st international innings since February
378.article_body: Team India stand-in captain KL Rahul, who got dismissed after scoring one run off five balls in the second ODI against Zimbabwe, said he needed "some time in the middle" in the game but "unfortunately, it didn't happen". Rahul was playing his first international innings since his 49-run outing against the West Indies in an ODI in February.

379.title: 2 Russians, 1 Ukrainian try to enter Albanian military plant, held
379.article_body: Two Russian nationals and one Ukrainian national were arrested after they tried to enter a military plant in central Albania, the country's Defence Ministry said on Saturday. "The officers who were guarding the plant reacted immediately, but during their efforts...two of our soldiers were injured," it added. Albanian PM Edi Rama said that the trio are "suspected of espionage".

380.title: Justice done can quickly be undone if people don't have right discourse: SC judge
380.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice DY Chandrachud said that justice done can quickly be undone if people do not continue with the right discourse to safeguard the interests of marginalised groups. "I am merely questioning the discourse that class actions (lawsuits) in courts are the only way to meaningfully claim the rights in public spaces?" Justice Chandrachud added.

381.title: Fraudster uses BEST GM's profile pic, texts employees to extort money
381.article_body: Several Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) employees received a 'friendly text' on WhatsApp from a number which claimed to be their General Manager Lokesh Chandra and tried to extort money. The WhatsApp number would have Chandra's profile picture and the modus-operandi would be an excuse that he is about to step into an important meeting and urgently require money.

382.title: Pak media watchdog bans live broadcast of Imran Khan's speeches
382.article_body: The Pakistan Electronic Media Regulatory Authority (PERMA) on Saturday banned the live broadcast of former PM Imran Khan's speeches after he threatened police and a female magistrate in a speech. The media watchdog said that Khan's recorded speeches will be aired only after an effective delay mechanism is put in place to ensure effective monitoring and editorial control.

383.title: 20-yr-old man makes minor girls beg at Pune signal, takes their money; booked
383.article_body: A 20-year-old man has been booked for making two minor girls beg at a traffic signal in Pune. A team of the Social Security Cell saw the accused with the girls at the traffic signal, police said, adding that he was making the girls beg and was taking money himself. The girls were rescued and sent to a children's home.

384.title: IAS officer lists how to use newspapers for preparation of civil services exam
384.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Sharan listed things people could read in newspapers to prepare for civil services exam. "Read one Hindi/English national newspaper. Focus on editorial page. Read for maximum 1-2 hours. Don't make a habit of making notes from newspaper. Read Yojana, Kurukshetra, Frontline with any one monthly magazine (Chronicle/Darpan)," the officer tweeted in Hindi.

385.title: It is cheating: Wipro Chairman on employees moonlighting in tech industry
385.article_body: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji took to Twitter to criticise the practice of 'moonlighting' by employees in the tech industry. "There is a lot of chatter about people moonlighting...This is cheating - plain and simple," Premji tweeted. Moonlighting refers to the practice of employees working on a second job, in addition to one's regular employment.

386.title: Didn't force teacher to resign: St Xavier's VC amid controversy over her Insta pics
386.article_body: St Xavier's University Vice-Chancellor Father Felix Raj said the college didn't force any teacher to resign over her Instagram posts. He added, "She was on probation. She served us...for two months…There's no question of force. There were some unpleasant developments, of course." The teacher had alleged that she was forced to resign over her private bikini pictures posted on Instagram.

387.title: 22 die in Himachal Pradesh amid rains, landslides; IMD issues orange alert
387.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert for Himachal Pradesh after 22 people were killed in the state due to heavy rainfall and landslides since Friday. An official said that maximum damage has been reported from Mandi, Kangra and Chamba districts and that 36 weather related incidents have been reported from the state so far.

388.title: Mumbai Police detains barber after receiving '26/11-style' terror threat
388.article_body: The Mumbai Police detained a barber from Virar for questioning after several WhatsApp messages were received on Mumbai's Traffic Control Room number, warning of a '26/11 like' terror strike. The barber hails from UP and had recently shifted to Virar, the police said. The number from which threats were issued, had a Pakistan series sim card, the police added.

389.title: Bowled in right areas, didn't think about wickets: Siraj on his 1/16 in 2nd ODI
389.article_body: Revealing his plan after India's five-wicket win against Zimbabwe in second ODI, India pacer Mohammed Siraj said his plan was to hit an area consistently without worrying whether he'll get wickets or not. "Just wanted to keep hitting the right areas and bowl dot balls to build up pressure on the opposition," he added. Siraj posted bowling figures of 8-2-16-1.

390.title: Bus hits emergency teams in south Turkey, 15 killed
390.article_body: At least 15 people were killed and nearly two dozen were hurt after a passenger bus hit emergency personnel working at the site of an earlier road accident in southern Turkey on Saturday. Two journalists, two paramedics and three firefighters were among the deceased. The remaining deaths were of the occupants of the bus, Turkish Interior Minister Suleyman Soylu said.

391.title: ATS arrests man from Shirdi in Amritsar IED case
391.article_body: The Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad has arrested a man from Shirdi in connection with the case of placing a bomb under the vehicle of Punjab Police sub-inspector Dilbagh Singh in Amritsar. The joint operation between the Squad and the Punjab Police led to his arrest. Earlier this week, Punjab Police arrested two people from Delhi.

392.title: Delhi police bust extortion racket worth ₹500 crores, 22 arrested
392.article_body: Delhi Police have bust an instant loan-cum-extortion racket amounting to over ₹500 crores and arrested 22 people from across the country in connection to it, officials said on Saturday. Chinese nationals are the masterminds of this racket, they said. The extorted money would be routed out of the country through hawala and cryptocurrencies.

393.title: US scholar Chomsky, others urge SC to free Teesta in Gujarat riots case
393.article_body: Top international scholars, including American linguist Noam Chomsky, have urged Indian Supreme Court to free activist-journalist Teesta Setalvad and ex-DGP RB Sreekumar in the 2002 Gujarat riots case. The SC "unfairly" attributed ulterior motives to the two while dismissing their plea, their statement read. "We're dismayed by the recent tendency discernible in the...[court's] judgment," it added.

394.title: To win more Slams, break longest world no. 1 record: Djokovic on his goals
394.article_body: Stating his "clear goals", 21-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic said he believes that he can win more Grand Slams and can break the longest world number one record. With total 373 weeks, Djokovic holds the record for spending the most number of weeks atop the ATP rankings. Steffi Graf held the top spot for 377 weeks, an all-time record.

395.title: Mother fell unconscious during bombing: Djokovic on 1999 Serbia war
395.article_body: Novak Djokovic said his family getting caught in the 1999 war in Serbia is one of his "most traumatic experiences". Novak said the sudden bombings around their then house led to his mom hitting her head and falling unconscious. The tennis star's father took charge, got Novak's mother up and the family grabbed what they could to escape the area.

396.title: Gujarat records 258 new COVID-19 cases, 3 deaths
396.article_body: Gujarat added 258 fresh cases to its COVID-19 tally on Saturday, a state health department official informed. The state also recorded three deaths due to the infection, the official added. As many as 637 recoveries were also recorded. Gujarat's active caseload declined to 2,553 on Saturday from 2,935 on Friday.

397.title: No quick solution to extremely heavy F1 cars: Max Verstappen
397.article_body: F1 championship leader Max Verstappen says there is no quick solution to reducing the weight of the cars, which is currently the heaviest in the sport's history. "They're extremely heavy, which I think is not great...overall, the following and stuff has been a bit better," said the Red Bull racer. F1 drivers have complained that the heavy cars are sluggish.

398.title: 18-yr-old Bihar girl consumes poison as boyfriend refuses to marry her
398.article_body: An 18-year-old girl consumed poison on Thursday in Bihar's Bhojpur district after her boyfriend mocked her and refused to marry her following a consensual physical relationship, local media reported. The girl's mother said that she was in a relationship with a young man for two years. The victim, identified as Priyanka Kumari, is currently in a hospital.

399.title: Man survives after 12-foot alligator bites his head in US, incident caught on camera
399.article_body: A Florida man survived an alligator attack after the 12-foot reptile bit his head. Juan Carlos LaVerde was swimming in Lake Thonotosassa, Florida on August 3 when the incident took place. Aerial footage shows the alligator headed straight for the ex-member of the US Air Force Pararescue, who was working on an instructional video at the time of the attack.

400.title: Waqar Younis says 'Shaheen's injury a big relief for Indian top-order batters', gets trolled
400.article_body: Reacting to Pakistani pacer Shaheen Afridi getting ruled out of Asia Cup, ex-Pakistan captain Waqar Younis tweeted, "Shaheen’s injury [is a] big relief for the Indian top-order [batters]." Younis was trolled by Indian fans for his remark. "If one player's absence makes a team clueless...then that team's...a joke," wrote a fan. "Will you decide by just one match?" another wrote.

401.title: Just fantastic: Graeme Smith on India playing Tests under Kohli
401.article_body: Former South Africa captain Graeme Smith said "it was just fantastic" to see India take Test cricket seriously under Virat Kohli's captaincy. "India led [the] way in Test cricket under Kohli. It was just fantastic," said Smith. Considering the level of competitiveness, he added that only five or six nations might be able to play Test cricket currently.

402.title: Former UK minister endorses Rishi Sunak's candidacy in PM race
402.article_body: Senior Conservative Party MP Michael Gove on Saturday endorsed Rishi Sunak's candidacy for the post of the UK's Prime Minister. Gove branded the tax reduction plans of Liz Truss, who is Sunak's opponent in the PM race, as a “holiday from reality”. “I know what the job requires. And Rishi has it,” Gove wrote in ‘The Times’ newspaper.

403.title: I am telling you no bowlers want to bowl to Kohli when he crosses 15-20 runs: Chahal
403.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said, "If he's there at the crease and has 15-20 runs behind him...I'm telling you no bowler wants to bowl to him." He added, "You just see his average across...formats...problem is we just think about his hundreds, we don't talk about those valuable contributions of 60-70 because of the standards he has set."

404.title: Karnataka logs 1,713 fresh COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths
404.article_body: Karnataka logged 1,713 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 5.33% on Saturday, the state health department said. Four deaths due to the infection were also reported. Two deaths were reported from Dharwad district while one fatality each was recorded in Bengaluru Rural and Mysuru. Karnataka's active case tally stood at 10,452, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin.

405.title: Chhattisgarh govt to set up English medium colleges in every district
405.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government has decided to set up English medium colleges in every state district over the next three years. The institutes will be named as Swami Atmanand English Medium Model Colleges, CM Bhupesh Baghel said. Notably, the move is aimed at encouraging native students to pursue higher studies in the state and reduce parents' financial burden, an official said.

406.title: Plan made in UAE to smuggle 500-kg drugs from Pak: NIA on Guj drug case
406.article_body: National Investigation Agency's fresh chargesheet in the Salaya drug seizure case revealed that the conspiracy to smuggle 500-kg heroin from Pakistan to Gujarat in 2018 was hatched in Dubai, UAE. It said the heroin, costing ₹1,500 crore in the international market, was to be further delivered to Punjab for raising funds by a Pakistani national and to harm Indian youths.

407.title: 13 injured in bus-oil tanker collision in Himachal's Kangra
407.article_body: A collision between a private bus and an oil tanker in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra district on Saturday left 13 passengers injured, officials said. According to officials, the accident took place at Sadwan in Nurpur sub-division. The injured were rushed to Civil Hospital Nurpur, officials added. One of the injured has been referred to Tanda hospital, a Civil Hospital official said.
